intro: Camissoniopsis confusa, commonly known as the slender camisson, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has small, linear leaves and produces seeds in capsule fruits. Camissoniopsis confusa is often found in California and adjacent regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
